question: In context with electromagnetism, which among the following is a correct definition of Permeability?
option1: Ability of a material to repel magnetic field within itself
option2: Ability of a material to support the formation of a magnetic field within another body
option3: Ability of a material to support the formation of a magnetic field within itself
option4: Ability of a material to create magnetic dipoles
answer: Ability of a material to support the formation of a magnetic field within itself
explanation: Ability of a material to support the formation of a magnetic field within itself is Permeability. It is the measure of the resistance of a material against the formation of a magnetic field.
